active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the potential risks of neglecting non-technical stakeholders (e.g., executives or legal teams) in TI planning. Provide evidence from NIST CSF GV.OC-02 and real-world breaches where poor engagement led to failures.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Threat Intelligence Frameworks. Topic: Stakeholder Identification and Engagement (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Threat Intelligence And Hunting > Threat Intelligence Frameworks > 003_Threat Intelligence Lifecycle > 002_Planning and Direction > Stakeholder Identification and Engagement). Use this research context: Stakeholders are individuals/groups affected by TI/hunting; key frameworks include NIST CSF 2.0 (GV.OC-02: Understand internal/external stakeholders' needs), MITRE ATT&CK, Cyber Kill Chain, Diamond Model. Sources: nist.gov/cyberframework, attack.mitre.org, lockheedmartin.com/en-us/capabilities/cyber/cyber-kill-chain.html. Incorporate these pedagogical elements: - Learning Objectives: [insert full list above]. - Scaffolding: Generate cards progressing through 4 layers [insert descriptions]. - Active Learning: End explanations with ties to activities (e.g., 'Apply in peer teaching'). - Prior Knowledge: Reference TI basics. Output 25 flashcards in JSON array format: [{'type': 'MCQ|Q&A|Cloze', 'layer': 1-4, 'blooms_level': 'Remember|etc.', 'question': '...', 'correct_answer': '...', 'distractors': ['d1','d2','d3'] (for MCQ only), 'explanation': '...'}]. Follow flashcard_schema exactly. Ensure completeness (all frameworks), measurable (quiz-ready), distractors per protocol. Optimize for Anki/spaced repetition: Active recall, no hints in questions.
